title: Be wary of scams this holiday season!
body:
Greetings all!

I wanted to take a moment to remind everyone the importance of account security and what you can do to protect yourself!

Please note that any promotions or events we may do would be announced on www.riotgames.com, www.leagueoflegends.com, or www.lolesports.com.

General questions:
Q: I was sent a suspicious link from a friend I trust but I don’t recognize it, what should I do?
A: USE CAUTION! If it’s not hosted on one of the websites above, we cannot ensure your computer’s security if you visit them. Remember, facechecking the web is dangerous, so use your best judgement. Be sure to have your antivirus programs up-to-date. 

Q: But I entered my username and password into this website! Should I change my password?
A: YES! Please change your password immediately. You can change your password by logging into your [account management](https://account.leagueoflegends.com/management) and clicking on change password. 

If you cannot log into your account at all, you can recover your password by using the password recovery [here](https://na.leagueoflegends.com/account/recovery/password). Still having issues? Please contact [support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/requests/new).

We also have an extensive Knowledge Base article available with additional tips and tricks on what you can do to ensure your account is secure: https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751664-Protecting-Your-Account – Please give this a read through if you have a chance!

Hey i hope someone from riot reads this and does something about it. These level one accounts have been being created and spamming players with links for a lot longer than a couple weeks, i first recall receiving one this past summer. I didn't get any for a while but its started happening to me and several friends of mine again recently. A simple fix to this would be to restrict the ability of accounts that are not at least level 2 from sending messages. Dont restrict the ability to add friends, as a lot of players make a league account for the first time and want to add the friend who recommended the game right away, but disable the chat service for level 1's. If a player is legitimately level one theyll probably be communicating with their friend who got them on league through a voice service like skype or mumble anyway, and not being able to use the chat for all of level one (really isnt that long) isnt such a bad thing. This will greatly discourage spammers and scammers as they wont want to make 100 accounts (or however many) and play on them until they level up to 2. This will also reduce "trash" accounts on league that are nothing but taken names and this is a change i hope to see it implemented in the near future.

Actually a good idea, because I stopped accepting "friend" requests unless I KNOW FOR A FACT that that person who wants to see me online was in the previous match with me. That's the only way I know that they are legit people and not scams or even the "coaching groups to step up your game".

Trust your gut! If it's not leagueoflegends.com; riotgames.com; or lolesports.com, then it's no good... or at least, it's not from us in any capacity.

Seeing as the website you mentioned is none of the above... ;)
But we can trust Lolking-like giveaways right?

We love it when our community does their own celebrations, contests, giveaways -- that's what makes our players so cool! We don't want to discourage players from doing said cool things, but we also want to make sure our players are making well-informed decisions when navigating the web.

As Zielmann said, just don't use your League of Legends login credentials on anything that isn't one of the 3 websites Riot Cluvie listed, and be hesitant about clicking on anything you don't recognise if sent to you in-game/client.

I wouldn't say this is 100% guaranteed, but *generally* if it's a giveaway where you get a promo code that you enter into the store yourself to redeem the skin or RP, it's probably okay (provided you trust the site as well).

As a general rule, if the site isn't one of the three that Slumber Jack mentioned above, and it tries to have you 'log in' with your account details, or requests your username/password in any fashion, stay away.

Links for that have been popping up on the forums a lot lately. It's a bit like watching a game of whack-a-mole as the mods go through and delete the threads. I'm guessing this is a big part of why they made this thread, but they also didn't want to directly call out an individual example of the scam.

This announcement is basically to say "if you don't see it coming directly from Riot, don't trust it." This should be pretty common sense, but it's probably good to put out such a reminder.

If it is a real promotion, Riot will announce it from the start. And the announcement won't be difficult to find.

Most of these ones are pyramid scheme scams. As I suspect there aren't any ads on the site, but if you get enough clicks you will have to "log in" and they will tell you to wait a day for the RP. As you send the link for friends, some will fall for it and they will send the link to others too. This way they will get some accounts stolen along with some RP.
Most scams sound too good to be true. It kills me that some players can't even see through that. Hopefully everybody who has made a mistake though, will promptly recover their accounts.
